sourcing.instructions: La (Lanthanum) - Obtain from a chemical supplier or online store specializing in rare earth metals. Nd (Neodymium) - Purchase from a chemical supplier or rare earth materials supplier. O (Oxygen) - Use as part of air during the process; ensure proper ventilation. Sn (Tin) - Acquire from a metal supply store or online retailer specializing in metals.
steps: La (Lanthanum) - Obtain from a chemical supplier or online store specializing in rare earth metals. Nd (Neodymium) - Purchase from a chemical supplier or rare earth materials supplier. O (Oxygen) - Use as part of air during the process; ensure proper ventilation. Sn (Tin) - Acquire from a metal supply store or online retailer specializing in metals.

1. Measure 44.8 g of La, 10.4 g of Nd, 4.8 g of O, and 60.0 g of Sn using a precision scale. 2. In a clean and dry mixing container, add La, Nd, and Sn. 3. Gradually introduce O in the form of an oxide powder. 4. Use a mechanical mixer to blend the materials thoroughly for at least 15 minutes until homogeneous.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure 44.8 g of La, 10.4 g of Nd, 4.8 g of O, and 60.0 g of Sn using a precision scale. 2. In a clean and dry mixing container, add La, Nd, and Sn. 3. Gradually introduce O in the form of an oxide powder. 4. Use a mechanical mixer to blend the materials thoroughly for at least 15 minutes until homogeneous.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powder into a crucible. 2. Heat the crucible in a furnace to 1200째C at a rate of 10째C/min. 3. Maintain the temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction of the materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powder into a crucible. 2. Heat the crucible in a furnace to 1200째C at a rate of 10째C/min. 3. Maintain the temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction of the materials.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to room temperature naturally, which may take approximately 4-6 hours. 2. Do not open the furnace until it has cooled completely to avoid rapid oxidation.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to room temperature naturally, which may take approximately 4-6 hours. 2. Do not open the furnace until it has cooled completely to avoid rapid oxidation.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use sandpaper (grit 400) to smooth out the surface of the sample. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance durability and prevent oxidation. Allow the sealant to cure for 24 hours before handling.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use sandpaper (grit 400) to smooth out the surface of the sample. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance durability and prevent oxidation. Allow the sealant to cure for 24 hours before handling.
